title: Dollar Strength Is Off The Table Now: Harrison
text: Gold is at its highest levels ever in nominal dollars, bolstered by negative real interest rates, strong asset prices, and inflation expectations.

title: Oil prices rise on U.S. stimulus hopes, weaker U.S. dollar
text: Oil prices rose for a third straight day on Tuesday, buoyed by support for demand coming from efforts to stimulate the U.S. economy’s recovery from the coronavirus crisis and a weakening of the dollar that makes crude cheaper for global buyers.

title: Gold rockets toward $2,000 as Fed stimulus sinks dollar
text: Gold rocketed to record peaks at $1,975 on Tuesday while the U.S. dollar plumbed two-year lows as investors wagered the Federal Reserve would reaffirm its super-easy policy outlook this week, and a tolerance for higher inflation.

title: Who Says You Can’t Time the Stock Market?
text: First it was the Junk Bonds ETF (JNK) closing above its 50-week moving average on Friday. Then today Junk bonds rallied again, with JNK rallying up to yet another new high since the March low.

title: Gold mining stocks are outperforming gold
text: As gold prices hit new highs to exceed its prior peak of around $1,900, investors may want to consider foregoing buying the physical commodity in favor of mining stocks, according to Barron’s’ Andrew Bary. Gold’s strong surge Gold is up nearly 30% since the start of 2020, making it one of the better performing investments this year.

title: Asian stocks set to rise on U.S. stimulus hopes, gold hits record

title: Investors Preferred Passive ETFs Over Active Strategies in Volatile 2020
text: As the markets oscillated in volatile trading this year, investors looked to passive or index-based exchange traded funds, forgoing the acumen of stock pickers in active strategies. Investors fled well-known active investment houses in favor of cheap passive products, with BlackRock and Vanguard among the most popular destinations, Financial Times reports.
